list_definition.definition: a flat instrument held in the hand and waved to direct a current of air across the face in hot weather

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Ladies used to carry fans to keep themselves cool.

list_definition.definition: a mechanical instrument causing a current of air

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has had a fan fitted in the kitchen for extracting cooking smells.

list_definition.definition: to cool (as if) with a fan

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She sat in the corner, fanning herself.

list_definition.definition: to increase or strengthen (a fire) by directing air towards it with a fan etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They fanned the fire until it burst into flames.

list_definition.mean_english: người hâm mộ; người say mê
list_definition.definition: an enthusiastic admirer of a sport, hobby or well-known person

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’m a great fan of his
(also adjective) fan mail/letters (= letters etc sent by admirers).
